meanings.definition: Provide with more service than is necessary or required.
meanings.sent1: The hotel staff overserviced the guests by constantly asking if they needed anything.
meanings.sent2: The car dealership overserviced the customers by offering unnecessary add-ons.
meanings.sent3: The robot butler overserviced its owner by constantly tidying up even when not asked.
meanings.sent4: The overeager waiter overserviced the table, anticipating every need before it was even voiced.
meanings.sent5: The customer felt overserviced when the salesperson kept recommending products they didn't need.

meanings.definition: To give excessive or unnecessary attention or assistance to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher overserviced the student by constantly checking on their progress.
meanings.sent2: The helicopter parent overserviced their child by micromanaging every aspect of their life.
meanings.sent3: The helpful neighbor overserviced by offering to mow the lawn every day.
meanings.sent4: The overprotective bodyguard overserviced the celebrity, not allowing them any privacy.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic volunteer overserviced the event, trying to help with everything at once.
